thread.title: Bridge patrol sergeant booked in woman's shooting
thread.title_full: Bridge patrol sergeant booked in woman's shooting - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: Bridge patrol sergeant booked in woman's shooting
text:
NEW ORLEANS (AP) - A sergeant with the Louisiana police unit that patrols the Crescent City Connection bridge at New Orleans has been booked with attempted second-degree murder in the shooting of a woman at a suburban home.
Authorities said the shooting was reported early Saturday. A caller to the Jefferson Parish Sheriff's Office said her mother had been shot by her stepfather at a home in the New Orleans suburb of Metairie.
The 53-year-old woman was found on a bathroom floor with gunshot wounds to the arm and face. The wounds were not considered life-threatening.
Deputies arrested 47-year-old David J. Kramer of Metairie, a sergeant with the state Department of Public Safety Crescent City Connection unit overseen by state police. Bond had not been set as of Saturday afternoon.
